subject: Religion & Spirituality
title: Stephen Jay Gould: Non-Overlapping Magisteria
description: Learn Stephen Jay Gould: Non-Overlapping Magisteria in one minute.

hook.text: Science asks how. Religion asks why. They cover different territory. Gould said they should stop fighting and cooperate.

buildup.text: Paleontologist Stephen Jay Gould proposed NOMA: science and religion are separate domains that need not conflict.

discovery.text: Science covers the empirical world: facts, laws, mechanisms. Religion covers meaning, values, and moral purpose.

twist.text: Critics say NOMA is too neat. Religion does make factual claims. Science does affect meaning. The domains overlap.

climax.text: NOMA is imperfect but useful. It says: before you fight, make sure you're actually disagreeing about the same thing.

punchline.text: Science asks how, religion asks why. The fight starts when they cross lanes.

quiz.question: What is NOMA?
options: The idea that science and religion address different, non-overlapping domains
